content: The Act is titled the "Private Mortgage Insurance Technical Corrections and Clarification Act." It includes changes in the amortization schedule. The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to address Adjustable Rate Mortgages by changing the definition of "amortization schedule then in effect." This is part of the "Private Mortgage Insurance Technical Corrections and Clarification Act." The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to address Adjustable Rate Mortgages by changing the definition of "amortization schedule then in effect" to reflect the schedule established at the time of the residential mortgage transaction. This amendment clarifies the treatment of balloon mortgages. The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to clarify the treatment of balloon mortgages and loan modifications. Balloon mortgages that do not fully amortize over the term and contain a conditional right to refinance are considered adjustable rate mortgages. Loan modifications are addressed in a new subsection of the Act. The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to address balloon mortgages and loan modifications. A new subsection specifies that if a loan is modified in a residential mortgage transaction, the cancellation date will be recalculated based on the modified terms. Conforming amendments are made to Section 4(a) of the Act. The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to address balloon mortgages and loan modifications. Amendments include changes to section 3(g) and 3(f) of the Act regarding loan modifications. SEC. 3. Deletion of ambiguous references to residential mortgages. The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to clarify termination of private mortgage insurance on residential mortgage transactions and disclosure requirements. Amendments include removing ambiguous references to "mortgage or" and inserting "residential mortgage or residential." The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to clarify termination of private mortgage insurance on residential mortgage transactions and disclosure requirements. Amendments include removing ambiguous references to "mortgage or" and inserting "residential." Amendments to the Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 clarify termination of private mortgage insurance on residential mortgage transactions by removing ambiguous references and inserting "residential." SEC. 4. CANCELLATION RIGHTS AFTER CANCELLATION DATE. Section 3 of the Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 is amended to include new requirements for the mortgagor to fulfill in order to extend the cancellation date. This includes being current on mortgage payments. Additionally, subsection (e)(1)(B) is revised to remove a reference to subsection (a)(3). Subsection (e)(1)(B) is revised to remove a reference to subsection (a)(3) and insert "subsection (a)(4)". Clarification of cancellation and termination issues and lender-paid mortgage insurance disclosure requirements are addressed in Section 5. The amortization period in a residential mortgage transaction ends upon the completion of the scheduled amortization period.
